intro: Dysoxylum insulare, commonly known as the island dysoxylum, is a tropical tree native to the Indo-Pacific region. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by fleshy, orange-red berries. It is often found in coastal areas and lowland forests, thriving in humid, warm climates. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
